content:
• Tuesday, February 7, 2017
  • MC

    Moelis pulls off investment banking coup with Saudi Aramco mandate

    • Moelis & Co. (NYSE:MC) has beaten out the likes of Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse, and HSBC to be chosen as the sole independent adviser for the Saudi Aramco IPO, according to the FT.
    • It would be the biggest equity advisory mandate to date for the boutique investment bank founded by veteran rainmaker Ken Moelis in 2007.
      The Saudis are hoping to value Aramco at about $2T, and are reportedly planning to sell a 5% stake (roughly $100B worth) at some point next year.
    • The next prize will be which exchange will be chosen to list on. While NYC was thought to be on the outs thanks to U.S. legislation giving families of victims of the 9/11 attacks the right to sue Saudi Arabia, the selection of NY-based Moelis might give more hope to the NYSE (NYSE:ICE).
    • Moelis is higher by 2.4% in thin after hours action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 PM | 6 Comments
  • USNA

    USANA Health Q4 sales up 9%; earnings off 9%; shares down 21% after hours on consensus miss

    • USANA Health Sciences (NYSE:USNA) Q4 results ($M): Net Sales: 252.9 (+8.7%); Asia Pacific: 193.4 (+12.4%); Greater China: 129.0 (+11.9%).
    • Active Associates: 471,000 (+11.9%); Asia Pacific: 384,000 (+15.3%); Greater China: 276,000 (+17.9%).
    • Active Preferred Customers: 93,000 (+4.5%); Asia Pacific: 29,000 (+11.5%); Greater China: 5,000 (+25.0%).
    • Net Income: 21.9 (-8.7%); EPS: 0.87 (-5.4%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Net Sales: $1.04B - 1.07B; EPS: $3.80 - 4.10.
    • Shares are down 21% after hours on light volume as sales and earnings both missed consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 PM
  • SLS

    Galena readies equity offering; shares down 15% after hours

    • Galena Biopharma (GALE) slumps 15% after hours on robust volume in response to its announcement of a public offering of stock and warrants. Prices, volumes and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 PM | 20 Comments
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics FQ2 top line up 2%; hereditary cancer testing off 13%; earnings down 84%; cash flow ops down 65%; shares up 14% after hours on consensus beat

    • Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN) fiscal Q2 results ($M): Total Revenues: 196.5 (+1.7%); Molecular Diagnostic Testing: 183.9 (+0.7%); Hereditary Cancer Testing: 143.9 (-13.1%).
    • Net Income: 5.9 (-84.1%); Non-GAAP Net Income: 17.5 (-47.8%); EPS: 0.09 (-82.0% ); Non-GAAP EPS: 0.26 (-42.2%); CF Ops (6 mo.): 28.5 (-65.2%).
    • Fiscal 2017 Guidance: Total Revenues: $745M - 755M; EPS: $0.31 - 0.36; Non-GAAP EPS: $1.00 - 1.05.
    • Fiscal Q3 Guidance: Total Revenues: $188M - 190M; EPS: $0.08 - 0.10; Non-GAAP EPS: $0.23 - 0.25.
    • Shares are up 14% after hours on consensus beat on revenues and earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 PM
  • NEWR

    New Relic -1.22%; Q3 2017 over consensus, projections in line or better

    • Q3 2017 results – revenue $68.1M (+42.6% Y/Y, $1.68M above estimates), EPS -$0.09 ($0.05 above estimates), loss from operations $4.9M, cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments $195.6M (vs. $197.3M Q/Q)
    • Q4 2017 projections – revenue $70.3M-$71.3M (+34% to +36% Y/Y; consensus $69.41M), EPS -$0.14 to -$0.16 (consensus -$0.15), loss from operations $7.7M-$8.7M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $260.4M-$261.4M (+44% Y/Y; consensus $257.87M), EPS -$0.52 to -$0.54 (consensus -$0.58), loss from operations $27.4M-$28.4M
    • New Relic founder and CEO Lew Cirne: "In the third quarter, we delivered record revenue, while delivering significant margin expansion. Our growth is fueled by two of the biggest strategic priorities in the enterprise today – the shift to cloud-based platforms, and digital initiatives to analyze the data generated by and through these platforms. When companies want to understand the performance of their applications and the resulting customer experience and business outcomes, they choose New Relic. We believe New Relic is uniquely positioned to meet these needs with our comprehensive and highly scalable cloud-based digital intelligence platform."
    • After hours – (NYSE:NEWR) $36.50
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • Presentation
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 PM
  • MDP

    Time +3.5% on report of nondisclosure deal with Bronfman, Meredith

    • A group led by Edgar Bronfman Jr. along with Meredith Corp. (NYSE:MDP) has signed a nondisclosure deal with Time Inc. (TIME), The Wall Street Journal reports -- suggesting talks to acquire or merge with the veteran publisher are in advanced stages.
    • TIME has jumped 3.5% after hours on the news. Other companies have nondisclosure agreements with Time as well, WSJ says.
    • Bronfman's group had made overtures in the range of $18/share or more late in the fall (TIME closed today at $18.65), and Time chief Rich Battista's holiday memo told the staff not to be surprised by lots of M&A talk ahead.
    • Meanwhile, Time shares moved ahead in early January as publisher Meredith got into the merger mix.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • LGF.A

    DirecTV Now selling Starz as premium add-on

    • DirecTV Now (T +0.2%) has boosted premium offerings by adding Starz (LGF.A -0.1%, LGF.B -0.7%) and Starz Encore on the streaming service.
    • The add-on comes for $8/month and will feature three linear feeds (Starz, Starz Encore and Starz Kids & Family) along with more than 2,500 on-demand TV episodes and movies.
    • Starz sells its own over-the-top service for $8.99/month through an app that works as "TV Everywhere" for authenticated pay TV subscribers as well as its OTT offering.
    • After hours: LGF.A +1.6%; LGF.B -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • JIVE

    Jive Software +7.72%; above-consensus Q4 2016 recorded

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $51.69M (+3.1% Y/Y, $1.69M above estimates), EPS $0.07 ($0.04 above estimates), operating income $5.1M, cash flow from operations $9.8M
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $50M-$51M (consensus $51M), EPS $0.04-$0.05 (consensus $0.03), income from operations $3.3M-$4.3M, change in short-term billings -10% to 0%, free cash flow $10M-$12M
    • Jive Software CEO Elisa Steele: "Strong execution resulted in another quarter that exceeded our expectations as we achieved record revenue, continued to improve profitability, increased cash flow from operations and gained momentum across the business. . . . Based on the transformation work we did in 2016 to realign the company, we are strategically poised for success as we enter 2017. We have made great strides in our operational excellence initiatives, and have positioned Jive's unique value proposition in the market to solve the growing problems of digital fragmentation across the enterprise workplace. We have stabilized the business, and we are vigorously building the foundation for future growth while maintaining a disciplined cost structure.  We are confident that we are doing all the right things to generate increased demand for our products, as well as drive long-term value for both customers and shareholders."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:JIVE) $4.26
    • Presentation slides
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire, Hersha Hospitality rise on S&P index moves

    • Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB -3.6%) has reclaimed ground after hours, up 2.9% on news that it's joining the S&P MidCap 400.
    • The company will replace comScore (SCOR -1.6%) in that index, as comScore is headed for delisting before the open tomorrow morning. ComScore is down another 0.7% in late trading.
    • Meanwhile, Hersha Hospitality Trust (HT -1.4%) is up 3.3% after hours as it's replacing WCI Communities (WCIC -0.4%), set to be acquired by Lennar, in the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • The moves are effective after the close of trading on Friday.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCHP

    Microchip Technology +9.74%; Q3 2017, outlook confident

    • Q3 2017 results – revenue $881.2M (+59.6% Y/Y, $32.06M above estimates), EPS $1.05 ($0.19 above estimates), gross margin 57.8%, operating income $289.1M, net income from continuing operations $246.5M, cash flow from operations $290.8M
    • Dividend – Quarterly cash dividend of $0.361 declared, payable March 7, 2017 to shareholders of record February 21, 2017.
    • Q4 2017 projections – revenue $872M-$908M (consensus $861.68M), EPS $1.01-$1.11 (consensus $0.93), gross margin 58%-58.4%, operating expense 24%-25%, operating income 33%-34.4%, other expense $22.8M, income tax expense (benefit) 8%-9%, net income $241M-$266.4M, diluted common shares outstanding 238.4M-239.4M
    • Microchip Technology CEO Steve Sanghi: "Our December quarter financial results were extremely strong. Our non-GAAP net sales, gross margin percentage, operating profit percentage and diluted earnings per share all exceeded the high end of our updated guidance provided on November 29, 2016. We were not able to provide GAAP guidance for the December quarter due to our acquisition of Atmel. As a result of the 'go live' of our business system integration for Atmel on January 1, 2017, several of our customers requested early shipment of their product that was originally requested to be delivered in the early part of January.  We believe the impact from these customer requests added approximately one percent to our December quarter revenue.  Ordinarily we attempt to schedule these business system integrations in the middle of a quarter to minimize the impact on our quarterly revenue results.  As a result, investors should view the true end market demand for our products in the fiscal third quarter to be about one percent lower than our reported GAAP and non-GAAP net sales and our fiscal fourth quarter 2017 true end market demand to be about two percent higher than the midpoint of our GAAP and non-GAAP net sales guidance."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:MCHP) $76.40
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZG

    Zillow -5.8%+; Q4 2016 over expectations, high end of revenue forecasts at consensus

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $227.6M (+34.4% Y/Y, $5.3M above estimates), EPS $0.14 ($0.03 above estimates), adjusted EBITDA $54.7M (vs. $20.4M Y/Y)
    • Revenues – Marketplace $210.6M (+42% Y/Y) [Premier Agent $164.3M (+32% Y/Y), Other Real Estate $29.8M (+145% Y/Y), Mortgages $16.5M (+41% Y/Y)], Display $17M (-20% Y/Y)
    • Q1 2017 projections –revenue $232M-$237M (consensus $237.36M), adjusted EBITDA $36M-$41M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $1.03B-$1.05B (consensus $1.05B), adjusted EBITDA $190M-$210M
    • Zillow Group CEO Spencer Rascoff: "Zillow Group had a fantastic year in 2016. We set records for annual revenue and site traffic, and ended on a strong note with solid fourth quarter results that were ahead of expectations. We executed on all of our strategic priorities for the year and completed the roll out of our self-serve account interface to Premier Agents nationally. In 2017, we are committed to further extending our audience leadership in the online real estate category. We expect to pass the $1 billion annual revenue mark in 2017, and we will press our advantage with continued investment across all Zillow Group’s brands and emerging marketplaces."
    • After hours (NASDAQ:ZG) $35, -5.81%; (NASDAQ:Z) $34.51, -6.4%.
    • Prepared remarks
    • Conference call
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 3 Comments

  • YUMC

    KFC a bright spot for Yum China

    • Yum China (NYSE:YUMC) reports mixed results for its two key brands.
    • China Pizza Hut comparable sales fell off 3.0% in Q4 vs. +2.3% expected. China KFC comparabale were up 1.0% vs. +0.4% seen.
    • A total of 302 new restaurants were opened in Q4.
    • A more favorable tax environment helped Yum China boost its restaurant margin by a full three percentage points to 11.0%.
    • The company says a new $300M buyback program was approved by the board.
    • Previously: Yum China reports Q4 results (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • GMLP

    Golar LNG Partners to launch 4.5M-unit offering

    • Golar LNG Partners (NASDAQ:GMLP) -5.2% AH after commencing a public offering of 4.5M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 675K units.
    • GMLP says it plans to use the proceeds for general partnership purposes.

  • TWLO

    Twilio +2.55%; Q4 2016 results, revenue forecasts over expectations

    • Q4 2016 results – total revenue $82M (+59.7% Y/Y, $7.8M above estimates), EPS $0.00 ($0.05 above estimates), base revenue $75.2M (+73% Y/Y), income from operations $0.1M (vs. $5M loss from operations Y/Y)
    • Highlights – Active Customer Accounts as of December 31, 2016 36,606 (vs. 25,347 Y/Y), dollar-based net expansion rate 155% (vs. 172% Y/Y)
    • Q1 2017 projections – total revenue $82M-$84M (consensus $77.85M), EPS -$0.07 to -$0.06 (consensus -$0.04), base revenue $78M-$79M, loss from operations $6.5M-$5.5M, weighted average shares outstanding 88M
    • FY 2017 projections – total revenue $364M-$372M (consensus $352.57M), EPS -$0.19 to -$0.15 (consensus -$0.10), base revenue $351M-$355M, loss from operations $17M-$13M, weighted average shares outstanding 90M
    • Twilio co-founder and CEO Jeff Lawson: "Our fourth quarter and full year results demonstrate the power of our platform business model that starts with developers and extends to some of the largest enterprises in the world. As we look into 2017, we will continue to invest in innovation and growth with the goal of powering the software-based future of communications."
    • After hours – (NYSE:TWLO) $31.75
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 6 Comments
  • URBN

    Comparable sales flat at Urban Outfitters

    • Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) reports comparable retail segment sales were flat in Q4.
    • By brand, comparable sales increased 2.0% at Urban Outfitters and 1.2% at Free People, while they fell 2.9% at Anthropologie Group.
    • Wholesale segment sales were down 1% during the quarter.
    • URBN -3.77% AH to $25.01.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM

  • Oil slides further on huge jump in inventories

    • According to the API, crude inventories popped higher by 14.2M barrels last week - that would be the largest inventory build since late October.
    • Gasoline inventories rose 2.9M barrels; distillates by 1.37M.
    • Crude is adding to the day's losses, now down 2.4% to $51.73 per barrel.
    • USO -1% after hours
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, DWT, OILK, OILX, UWT
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 68 Comments
  • CHRS

    Coherus launches $125M equity offering; shares down 6% after hours

    • Coherus BioSciences (NASDAQ:CHRS) eases 6% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement of a $125M public offering of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment will be an additional $18.75M of common shares. Net proceeds will fund the build-out of the sales and marketing infrastructure for CHS-1701, the inventory build, manufacturing to support the commercial launch, clinical trials, working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM

    Gilead Q4 top line down 14%; antiviral sales down 16%; earnings down 34%; shares down 4% after hours

    • Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) Q4 results ($M): Total Revenues: 7,320 (-13.9%); Antiviral Sales: 6,595 (-16.4%).
    • Net Income: 3,108 (-33.6%); Non-GAAP Net Income: 3,585 (-26.7%); EPS: 2.34 (-26.4%); Non-GAAP EPS: 2.70 (-18.7%).
    • Key Product Sales: Harvoni: 1,640 (-51.0%); Epclusa: 1,048; Truvada: 868 (-7.3%); Atripla: 607 (-24.1%); Genvoya: 563 (+999%); Sovaldi: 541 (-65.0%); Stribild: 387 (-24.3%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Total Revenues: $22.5B - 24.5B; Non-HCV Sales: $15.0B - 15.5B; HCV Sales: $7.5B - 9.0B; Non-GAAP Gross Margin: 86 - 88%.
    • Shares are off 4% after hours on robust volume.

  • BWLD

    Sales momentum still lacking at Buffalo Wild Wings

    • Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) slumps in AH trading after company-owned same-store sales fell 4.0 vs. -1.7% expected in Q4.
    • Average weekly sales at company-owned stores fell 4.6% Y/Y to $59,120.
    • Labor costs rose 90 bps to 31.8%.
    • Restaurant operating costs +30 bps to 15.7%.
    • 2017 guidance: Same-store sales growth of 1% to 2%, restaurant-level margin +10 to 30 bps, chicken wing inflation +3.5% to +4.5% , operating income growth of 9% to 13%, share repurchases of $450M-$500M, EPS of $5.60-$6.00, capital expenditures of approximately $100M, free cash flow of $160M-$170M.
    • Previously: Buffalo Wild Wings misses by $0.40, misses on revenue (Feb. 7)
    • BWLD -5.21% AH to $142.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai Technologies +1.38%; Q4 2016 above expectations

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $616.12M (+6.4% Y/Y, $11.32M above estimates), EPS $0.72 ($0.04 above estimates)
    • Segment revenues – Performance and Security Solutions $367M (+17% Y/Y), Cloud Security Solutions (component of Performance and Security Solutions) $102M (+41% Y/Y), Media Delivery Solutions $196M (-10% Y/Y), Service and Support Solutions $53M (+14% Y/Y)
    • Geographic revenues – U.S. $424M (+2% Y/Y), International $193M (+18% Y/Y)
    • Customer revenues by division – Media Division $301M (-1% Y/Y), Web Division $300M (+13% Y/Y), Enterprise and Carrier Division $15M (+26M Y/Y)
    • Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ:AKAM) CEO Dr. Tom Leighton: "We were very pleased with how well we ended 2016, with both revenue and earnings exceeding our expectations for the fourth quarter. Our strong results were driven by robust seasonal traffic, continued rapid growth of our Cloud Security Solutions and the success of our recently launched new products.  As we look forward to 2017, we are very optimistic about the opportunities ahead of us and plan to continue investing in innovation and the expansion of our product portfolio."
    • Conference call
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 9 Comments
  • PE

    Parsley Energy to buy Permian properties for $2.8B, to offer 36M shares

    • Parsley Energy (NYSE:PE) -4% AH after agreeing to acquire undeveloped acreage and producing oil and gas properties in the Permian Basin from Double Eagle Energy Permian for ~$2.8B in cash and stock.
    • PE says the deal would add ~71K net acres to its Midland Basin acreage and bring total Permian Basin net acreage to ~227K acres.
    • As a result of the acquisition, PE raises its annual production outlook to 38.1K-38.3K boe/day from 37K-39K boe/day previously, and updates 2017 capital spending plans to $493K-$499K from an earlier view of $460M-$510M.
    • To fund the deal, PE launches a public offering of 36M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 5.4M shares, plus a private placement of $350M in aggregate principal amount of senior unsecured notes due 2025.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 6 Comments

  • AMC

    AMC down 1.5% on equity raise

    • The company is selling $500M worth of stock in a secondary offering. Underwriters Citigroup and BofA will be given a greenshoe option for up to another 15% of the amount of shares sold.
    • Proceeds will be used to pay down the bridge debt undertaken as part of the Carmike Cinemas purchase, with anything left over to go towards the Nordic Cinema acquisition.

    Akamai beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM): Q4 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $616.12M (+6.4% Y/Y) beats by $11.32M.
    • Shares +4%.

  • BB

    BlackBerry opening new stream with messaging developer kit

    • BlackBerry (BBRY +1.9%) is opening up a new revenue stream with a new software development kit aimed at building various communications apps, including chat, video and voice.
    • The launch of the BBM Enterprise SDK puts the firm into competition with others offering these services: Twilio (TWLO -2.8%), Bandwidth and Nexmo (VG -1.1%).
    • The Communications Platform-as-a-Service offering will come via subscription and promises secure messaging (one-to-one and group chats), secure voice and video calling, secure file sharing/collaboration and real-time push notifications. BlackBerry's partner network will be able to more easily integrate real-time communications, it says.
    • The company intends to lean on its reputation for security as a differentiator, COO Marty Beard says. He declined to talk revenue details to Bloomberg but said it would "add to growth."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 94 Comments
  • BP

    BP says it may be coming out of the trough

    • BP (BP -3.8%) continues ~4% lower as investors are unnerved by the news that it hiked its breakeven oil price target for 2017 to $60/bbl, up from $50-$55, even as the company indicates the problem is essentially a temporary one; BP's dividend yield now has climbed to ~7%, a sign of investor skepticism that payments are safe.
    • BP execs nevertheless struck a confident tone in today's earnings conference call, with CEO Bob Dudley believing the 2015-17 period "may prove to be the trough," highlighting growth prospects this year and beyond that are expected to bring online 800K bbl/day of new production by 2020.
    • After years of cost-cutting, BP expects 2017 capex of $16B-$17B, similar to 2016 but up from previous guidance of $15B-$17B for the year.
    • CFO Brian Gilvary said he sees oil prices staying comfortably above $50/bbl in 2017 and cash flow reaching $21B-$22B, enough to cover spending and dividend payouts; even if Brent prices do not hit $60, the dividend would not be affected, he said.
    • Dudley also said BP is looking at ways to "incrementally" increase its footprint in U.S. shale, but will use "a lot of discipline" in investing in the sector as asset prices are high.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 24 Comments
  • LRN

    Education sector reshuffles with new Education Secretary in place

    • The education sector is in focus after the U.S. Senate approves Betsy DeVos as the Education Secretary with Vice President Mike Pence breaking the 50-50 deadlock.
    • Gainers today include K12 (LRN +2%), Franklin Covey (FC +1.4%), New Oriental Education (EDU +1.8%) and Nord Anglia Education (NORD +2.4%), while DeVry Education (DV -1.8%), Grand Canyon Education (LOPE -1%) and Capella Education Company (CPLA -1.2%) are tilting lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: MVIS +13%. DRAM +13%. ISDR +12%. PRCP +12%.
    • Losers: OTC:GIGA -13%. SABR -12%. BMI -10%. ALLT -10%. AWRE -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AKG

    Asanko Gold -12.5% as mine mineral reserves not expected to change

    • Asanko Gold (AKG -12.5%) plunges as Canaccord downgrades shares to Hold from Speculative Buy, citing an update on its Asanko Gold mine expansion.
    • AKG indicated that mineral reserves are not expected to materially change, so as a result the firm cuts its expected reserve additions.
    • AKG yesterday said an independent review of the mine's mineral inventory showed no reason to anticipate a material change to reserves upon which current expansion projects are based.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics needs Belichick-style comeback, Evercore analyst says

    • Atwood Oceanics (ATW -1.6%) is lower again and has shed 12% since its Q4 earnings report, and Evercore ISI’s James West says ATW needs a “Belichick ‘capital structure playbook’ to pull off the balance sheet comeback."
    • Noting that ATW's net debt is just shy of $1B, Evercore says the company remains committed to calling additional plays from its "capital structure playbook" to reduce and/or stagger debt maturities in order to reduce refinancing risk, but with a ~$700M backlog, the firm sees liquidity as a continued concern considering the revolver maturing in 2019 and the bonds maturing in 2020.
    • Evercore says crude oil price improvement and recent contract wins provide some visibility in what could be the home stretch of the offshore drilling downturn, but the firm sees dilution risk associated with another possible equity raise as ATW already is highly leveraged.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALLT

    Allot Communications -8.9% despite Q4 beats

    • Allot Communications (NASDAQ:ALLT) has slid steadily today, now down 8.9%, despite a beat on top and bottom lines in Q4 earnings, in a retrenchment of 7% gains yesterday.
    • The company posted a non-GAAP operating profit of $1.8M for the quarter, narrowing the year's operating loss (non-GAAP) to $0.4M.
    • Book-to-bill ratio was below 1 for both Q4 and the full year.
    • Net cash and equivalents came to $113.7M as of Dec. 31, after positive operating cash flow of $4.2M.

  • TEVA

    Teva target of police investigation into alleged bribery abroad; shares down 4%

    • Israeli newspaper HAARETZ reports that Israeli Police are investigating Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA -4.2%) into reported bribery in certain countries, including Mexico, Russia and Ukraine.
    • The inquiry is reportedly centered on suspicions that the company paid bribes into the hundreds of millions and falsified documents in order to hide them. Bribes in Ukraine, for example, were concealed as sale and marketing expenses or as consultation fees.
    • In 2009, the company signed an OECD treaty against bribing officials in foreign countries. Violaters can receive up to seven years in prison.
    • In December 2016, Teva paid $519M in the U.S. to settle alleged violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act related to its conduct in the three countries mentioned above.
    • Special mention to SA Contributor Quoth the Raven for his early scoop of the story.
